children.name: Example
children.text: var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig();

children.name: GlideCurrencyConfig()
children.text:
Instantiates a GlideCurrencyConfig object that enables the retrieval of global default
    FX Currency configuration information.
children.text2:
When calling the available methods on this type of GlideCurrencyConfig object, the return values are the FX Currency global defaults from system properties. If a global default is not defined in system properties, a hard-coded default is returned (this can also be an empty value if not configured). This object does not provide configuration information for a specific FX Currency field. To retrieve specific FX Currency field information, use the GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed) constructor.

For more information, see Configuring FX Currency global settings.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXCurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed);

children.name: ed
children.text: GlideElementDescriptor
children.text2:
GlideElementDescriptor object of the FX Currency field to associate with the
                GlideCurrencyConfig object.

children.name: GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed)
children.text:
Instantiates a GlideCurrencyConfig object that enables the retrieval of the
    configuration information for a specific FX Currency field.
children.text2:
When calling the available methods on this type of GlideCurrencyConfig object, the return values are from the FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record associated with the FX Currency field, if a record exists. If a record does not exist, default values are returned.

For more information, see Configuring FX Currency global settings.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(); var curr_agg_source = cur_config.getAggregationSource();
children.text2: This code  returns the default aggregation source.

children.name: String
children.text:
Source of values for aggregations. The returned value depends on the constructor used to instantiate the object.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed): If an fx_configuration record exists, returns the aggregation_source field from the fx_configuration record that is associated with the FX Currency field specified by the GlideElementDescriptor passed in the constructor. If no fx_configuration record, follows the GlideCurrencyConfig() rules.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(): If set, returns the value in the glide.currency2.aggregation_source field in system properties. Otherwise, returns a hard-coded default of reference.
Possible values:
  • default
  • as_entered
  • reference

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXCurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed); var curr_agg_source = cur_config.getAggregationSource();
children.text2: This code  returns the aggregation source for a specific FX Currency field.

children.name: getAggregationSource()
children.text: Returns the aggregation source value for an FX Currency field.
children.text2:
If called on an existing FX Currency field that has a corresponding FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record, returns the value of the Aggregation Source (aggregation_source) field. Otherwise, if a new record, returns a default value.

For more information on aggregation source, see Specify the table field and its currency display parameters.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXCurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed); var curr_conv_date_src = cur_config.getConversionDateSource();
children.text2: This code  returns the conversion date source for a specific FX Currency field.

children.name: String
children.text:
Field in the record used as the conversion date source. The returned value depends on the constructor used to instantiate the object.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed): If an fx_configuration record exists, returns the conversion_date_source field from the fx_configuration record that is associated with the FX Currency field specified by the GlideElementDescriptor passed in the constructor. If no fx_configuration record, follows the GlideCurrencyConfig() rules.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(): Returns null.

children.name: getConversionDateSource()
children.text: Returns the field used as the source of the date and time for the currency conversion.
children.text2:
If called on an existing FX Currency field that has a corresponding FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record, returns the value of the Conversion Date Source (conversion_date_source) field. Otherwise, if a new record, returns "null".

For more information on the Conversion Date Source field, see Identify the rate table and date source for currency conversions.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(); var curr_display_digits = cur_config.getDisplayDigits();
children.text2: This code  returns the default number of display digits.

children.name: Number
children.text:
Number of digits to display for the FX Currency field. The returned value depends on the constructor used to instantiate the object.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed): If an fx_configuration record exists, returns the value of the display_digits field in the FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record that is associated with the FX Currency field specified by the GlideElementDescriptor passed in the constructor. If no fx_configuration record, follows the GlideCurrencyConfig() rules.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(): If set, returns the value of the glide.currency2.display_digits property in system properties. Otherwise, returns -1.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXCurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed); var curr_display_digits = cur_config.getDisplayDigits();
children.text2: This code  returns the display digits for a specific FX Currency field.

children.name: getDisplayDigits()
children.text: Returns the number of digits to display for an FX Currency field.
children.text2: If called on an existing FX Currency field that has a corresponding FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record, returns the value of the Display Digits (display_digits) field. Otherwise, if a new record, returns a default value.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(); var curr_display_value = cur_config.getDisplayValue();
children.text2: This code  returns the default currency code.

children.name: String
children.text:
Currency code to use to display the FX Currency field. The returned value depends on the constructor used to instantiate the object.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed): If an fx_configuration record exists, returns the display_value field, which contains the currency code, from the fx_configuration record that is associated with the FX Currency field specified by the GlideElementDescriptor passed in the constructor. If no fx_configuration record, follows the GlideCurrencyConfig() rules.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(): If set, returns the value of the glide.currency2.display_value property in system properties. Otherwise, returns as_entered.
Possible values:
  • default: Global default. This is the value in the glide.currency2.display_digits property.
  • as_entered: Currency value as entered by the user.
  • in_session_currency: Currency value converted to the session currency. Session currency is based on the user's locale.
  • in_reference_currency: Reference value if computed and stored. Otherwise, the currency value converted to the reference currency.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXCurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed); var curr_display_value = cur_config.getDisplayValue();
children.text2: This code  returns the display currency code for a specific FX Currency field.

children.name: getDisplayValue()
children.text:
Returns the currency code used to convert the FX Currency value when it appears in
    lists and reports.
children.text2: If called on an existing FX Currency field that has a corresponding FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record, returns the value of the Display Value Currency (display_value) field. Otherwise, if a new record, returns a default value.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed); var curr_reference_currency = cur_config.getRateFilterRateTableField();
children.text2:
This code  returns the rate table field used to filter rate table records for a
        specific FX Currency field.

children.name: String
children.text:
Field in the rate table used to filter the rate table records. The returned value depends on the constructor used to instantiate the object.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed): If an fx_configuration record exists, returns the rate_filter_rate_table_field from the fx_configuration record that is associated with the FX Currency field specified by the GlideElementDescriptor passed in the constructor. If no fx_configuration record, follows the GlideCurrencyConfig() rules.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(): Returns null.

children.name: getRateFilterRateTableField()
children.text:
Returns the rate table field used as a rate table filter for an FX Currency
    field.
children.text2:
If called on an existing FX Currency field that has a corresponding FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record, returns the value of the Rate Table Field (rate_filter_rate_table_field). Otherwise, if a new record, returns a default value.

For more information on rate table filters, see Select the rate and target table fields used for filtering.

children.name: String
children.text:
Field in the target table used/to use to filter the rate table. The returned value depends on the constructor used to instantiate the object.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed): If an fx_configuration record exists, returns the rate_filter_target_table_field from the fx_configuration record that is associated with the FX Currency field specified by the GlideElementDescriptor passed in the constructor. If no fx_configuration record, follows the GlideCurrencyConfig() rules.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(): Returns null.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(); var curr_rate_filter = cur_config.getRateFilterTargetTableField();
children.text2: This code  returns the default rate filter, target table field.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXCurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed); var curr_rate_filter = cur_config.getRateFilterTargetTableField();
children.text2:
This code  returns the rate filter, target table field for a specific FX Currency
        field.

children.name: getRateFilterTargetTableField()
children.text:
Returns the target table field used to filter the rate table records for an FX Currency
    field.
children.text2:
If called on an existing FX Currency field that has a corresponding FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record, returns the value of the Target Table Field (rate_filter_target_table_field). Otherwise, if a new record, returns a default value.

For more information on rate table filters, see Select the rate and target table fields used for filtering.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(); var curr_rate_table = cur_config.getRateTable();
children.text2: Returns the default rate table.

children.name: String
children.text:
Name of the rate table used to perform the currency conversion. The returned value depends on the constructor used to instantiate the object.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed): If an fx_configuration record exists, returns the rate_table_field field from the fx_configuration record that is associated with the FX Currency field specified by the GlideElementDescriptor passed in the constructor. If no fx_configuration record, follows the GlideCurrencyConfig() rules.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(): If set, returns the value of the glide.currency2.system_rate_table property from system properties. Otherwise, returns fx_system_rate.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXCurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed); var curr_rate_table = cur_config.getRateTable();
children.text2: Returns the rate table used for a specific FX Currency field.

children.name: getRateTable()
children.text: Returns the rate table used to convert currency for an FX Currency field.
children.text2:
If called on an existing FX Currency field that has a corresponding FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record, returns the value of the Rate Table Field (rate_filter_rate_table_field). Otherwise, if a new record, returns a default value.

For more information on FX Currency rate tables, see Identify the rate table and date source for currency conversions.

children.name: String
children.text:
Reference currency as an ISO currency code. The returned value depends on the constructor used to instantiate the object.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed): If an fx_configuration record exists, returns the reference_currency field from the fx_configuration record that is associated with the FX Currency field specified by the GlideElementDescriptor passed in the constructor. If no fx_configuration record, follows the GlideCurrencyConfig() rules.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(): If set, returns the value of the glide.currency2.default_reference_currency system property. Otherwise the method applies the following rules, in the specified order, to determine the reference currency code:
    • If the glide.system.reference_currency system property is set to true, uses the value in the glide.system.reference_currency.code system property.
    • The value in the glide.system.locale system property (which implies a currency).
    • Default locale of the Java Virtual Machine on which the instance is running.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(); var curr_reference_currency = cur_config.getReferenceCurrency();
children.text2: This code  returns the default reference currency.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXCurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed); var curr_reference_currency = cur_config.getReferenceCurrency();
children.text2: This code  returns the reference currency for a specific FX Currency field.

children.name: getReferenceCurrency()
children.text: Returns the reference currency for an FX Currency field.
children.text2:
If called on an existing FX Currency field that has a corresponding FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record, returns the value of the Reference Currency (reference_currency) field. Otherwise, if a new record, returns a default value.

For more information on reference currency, see Set the reference currency.

children.name: String
children.text:
Dot-walk path of the field used/to use as the reference currency. The returned value depends on the constructor used to instantiate the object.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed): If an fx_configuration record exists, returns the reference_currency_source field from the fx_configuration record that is associated with the FX Currency field specified by the GlideElementDescriptor passed in the constructor. If no fx_configuration record, follows the GlideCurrencyConfig() rules.
  • GlideCurrencyConfig(): Returns null.

children.name: Example
children.text: var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(); var curr_reference_currency = cur_config.getReferenceCurrencySource();
children.text2: This code  returns the default reference currency source.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grCurr = new GlideRecord('my_FXCurrency_table'); var curr_field = grCurr.getElement('currency'); var ed = curr_field.getED(); var cur_config = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConfig(ed); var curr_reference_currency = cur_config.getReferenceCurrencySource();
children.text2:
This code  returns the reference currency source for a specific FX Currency
        field.

children.name: getReferenceCurrencySource()
children.text: Returns the reference currency source for an FX Currency field.
children.text2:
If called on an existing FX Currency field that has a corresponding FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] record, returns the value (dot-walk path) of the Reference Currency Source (reference_currency_source) field. Otherwise, if a new record, returns a default value.

For more information on reference currency source, see Set the reference currency.

name: GlideCurrencyConfig
text: The GlideCurrencyConfig API provides methods to retrieve various configuration information for FX Currency fields.
text2:
You can acquire information for a specific FX Currency field by calling the GlideCurrencyConfig(Object ed) constructor, which associates a specific FX Currency field to the instantiated object. When calling the various GlideCurrencyConfig() methods, if a record exists in the FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] table for the FX Currency field, the requested value is passed back. If a record or field is not available, the default value is passed back. You can also acquire the default FX Currency configuration values by calling the GlideCurrencyConfig() constructor.

For additional information on FX Currency configuration, see Setting up and operating FX Currency fields.

This class runs is in the sn_currency namespace.

children.name: Example
children.text: var conv = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter();

children.name: GlideCurrencyConverter()
children.text: Instantiates a GlideCurrencyConverter object.

children.name: from
children.text: String
children.text2: Three-letter ISO 3166 country code of the source currency.

children.name: Example
children.text: var conv = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('EUR', 'USD');

children.name: to
children.text: String
children.text2: Three-letter ISO 3166 country code of the converted currency.

children.name: GlideCurrencyConverter(String from, String to)
children.text: Instantiates a GlideCurrencyConverter object and sets the source and destination country codes to use in the currency conversion.

children.name: Output
children.text: CurrencyExchangeValue{Rate = 1.0777, OriginalAmount = 100, Amount = 107.7700, fromCurrency = 'EUR', toCurrency = 'USD', rateSysId = '2ed537fcb271937adb'}

children.name: Example
children.text: var conv = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('EUR', 'USD'); conv.setAmount(100); gs.info(conv.convert());

children.name: Object
children.text:
If the conversion is successful, returns CurrencyExchangeValue object. If unsuccessful, returns "null".
CurrencyExchangeValue {
Rate: Number,
OriginalAmount: Number,
Amount: Number,
fromCurrency: String,
toCurrency: String,
rateSysId: String
}

Rate: Number. Exchange rate used in the conversion.

OriginalAmount: Number. Source currency amount.

Amount: Number. Converted amount (OriginalAmount * Rate).

fromCurrency: String. Three-letter ISO 3166 country code of the source currency.

toCurrency: String. Three-letter ISO 3166 country code of the converted currency.

rateSysId: String. Sys_id of the rate table record used to calculate the conversion.

children.name: convert()
children.text: Executes the currency converter.
children.text2: Call this method after calling other GlideCurrencyConverter methods that construct the currency conversion, such as setAmount(), setRateTable(), and setDate().

children.name: Example
children.text: var conv = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('EUR', 'USD'); conv.setAmount(100);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: amount
children.text: String
children.text2:
Currency amount to convert. This value must be unformatted except for a decimal
                point to denote fractional currency. For example, 1234.56 is valid, 1,234.56 is
                invalid.

children.name: setAmount(String amount)
children.text: Sets the amount of currency to convert.

children.name: date
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2:
Date/time for which to calculate the currency conversion. This value determines
                the rate that is used in the conversion.

children.name: Output
children.text: CurrencyExchangeValue{fOriginalAmount=100, fOriginalCurrency='EUR', fRate=1.061, fAmount=106.1, fCurrency='USD', fRateSysId='4555525f5553445f3130303030313031'}

children.name: Example
children.text: var conv = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('EUR', 'USD'); conv.setAmount(100); var gd = new GlideDateTime("2019-01-03 11:00:00"); conv.setDateTime(gd); gs.info(conv.convert());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setDateTime(Object date)
children.text: Sets the currency conversion date and time.
children.text2: This date and time determines the conversion rate that is used to convert the currency. If this method is not called before the GlideCurrencyConverter.convert() method, the conversion is performed using the rate for the current date/time.

children.name: Example
children.text: var conv = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter().setFromCurrency('FRA');

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: from
children.text: String
children.text2: Three-letter ISO 3166 country code of the source currency.

children.name: setFromCurrency(String from)
children.text: Sets the country code of the source currency.

children.name: rateTable
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the rate table to use in the currency conversion.

children.name: Example
children.text: var conv = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('EUR', 'USD'); conv.setRateTable(custom_rate_table);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setRateTable(String rateTable)
children.text: Defines the rate table to use in the currency conversion.
children.text2: If this method is not called before the GlideCurrencyConverter.convert() method is called, the conversion is performed using the fx_system_rate table. All custom rate tables must extend the fx_conversion_rate table. For additional information on creating rate tables, see Add conversion rates using a custom rate table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var conv = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter().setToCurrency('USA');

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: to
children.text: String
children.text2: Three-letter ISO 3166 country code of the source currency.

children.name: setToCurrency(String to)
children.text: Sets the country code of the destination currency.

name: GlideCurrencyConverter
text: The GlideCurrencyConverter API provides methods to convert one currency value to another, such as converting US dollars into European Euro.
text2:
You can instantiate the GlideCurrencyConverter object and define the source and destination currencies during instantiation using GlideCurrencyConverter(from, to). You can also instantiate the object without these values and define them later using the setFromCurrency() and setToCurrency() methods. These values and the amount to convert must be set before calling the convert() method to perform the currency conversion. To set the amount to convert, use the setAmount() method.

The GlideCurrencyConverter() API also provides optional methods that enable you to:
  • Set the date and time for which to perform the conversion, setDateTime(). By setting the date and time, the rate that is used in the conversion calculation is that for the specified date and time, instead of the default of the current date and time.
  • Set the rate table to use in the conversion, setRateTable(). By default the conversion uses the fx_system_rate table however, you can define custom rate tables for your instance. For additional information on creating rate tables, see Add conversion rates using a custom rate table.


This class runs is in the sn_currency namespace.

children.name: Output
children.text: Exchanged Amount: $92.00

children.name: Example
children.text: var conv = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('EUR', 'USD'); conv.setAmount(100); var convertValues = conv.convert(); gs.info('Exchanged Amount: ' + convertValues.getAmount());
children.text2: This  assumes a conversion rate of 1 Euro = .92 US dollars.

children.name: Number
children.text: Currency amount after the conversion.

children.name: getAmount()
children.text: Returns the currency amount after the conversion.

children.name: Output
children.text: Exchanged Currency (To): JPY

children.name: Example
children.text: var convertValues = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('USD', 'JPY'); convertValues.setAmount(100); gs.info('Exchanged Currency (To): ' + convertValues.convert().getCurrency());

children.name: String
children.text: Three-letter ISO currency code of the converted to currency.

children.name: getCurrency()
children.text: Returns the converted to currency type.

children.name: Output
children.text: Original Amount: USD

children.name: Example
children.text: var converter = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('USD', 'JPY'); converter.setAmount(999.999) var convertValues = converter.convert(); gs.info('Original Amount: ' + convertValues.getOriginalCurrency());

children.name: String
children.text: Three-letter ISO currency code of the currency converted from.

children.name: getOriginalCurrency()
children.text: Returns the original, pre-conversion currency type.

children.name: Output
children.text: Original Amount: 999.999

children.name: Example
children.text: var converter = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('USD', 'JPY'); converter.setAmount(999.999) var convertValues = converter.convert(); gs.info('Original Amount: ' + 'convertValues.getOriginalAmount());

children.name: Number
children.text: Original amount before conversion.

children.name: getOriginalValue()
children.text: Returns the original, pre-conversion amount.

children.name: Output
children.text: Exchange rate: 1.0559

children.name: Example
children.text: var converter = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('EUR', 'USD'); converter.setAmount(999.999) var convertValues = converter.convert(); gs.info('Original Amount: ' + convertValues.getRate());

children.name: Number
children.text: Exchange rate used in the currency conversion.

children.name: getRate()
children.text: Returns the exchange rate used during the conversion.

children.name: Output
children.text: Original Amount: 99ebb4156fa831005be8883e6b3ee4b9

children.name: Example
children.text: var converter = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyConverter('USD', 'JPY'); converter.setAmount(999.999) var convertValues = converter.convert(); gs.info('Rate table sys_id: ' + convertValues.getRateSysId());

children.name: String
children.text: Sys_id of the rate table used in the currency conversion.

children.name: getRateSysId()
children.text: Returns the sys_id of the record in the rate table used in the currency conversion.

name: GlideCurrencyExchangeValue
text: Provides access to information related to FX Currency conversions.
text2:
Refer to the GlideCurrencyConverter() API for methods that return a GlideCurrencyExchangeValue object.

Note: There is no constructor for this class.

children.name: formatString
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Format string to use to format any currency passed into the formatter.

Valid values:

  • %s: Replaced by the currency symbol associated with the country code specified in the format() call.
  • %v: Replaced by the currency amount, such as 123.45.
  • %c: Replaced by the ISO currency code specified in the format() call, such as USD or EUR.
  • %l: Replaced with the passed in value, no formatting performed.
  • %p: Replaced by the percent sign (%).

For example, if the format string is '%s%v%c' and the value to format is 123.45 in US dollars, the returned formatted string is $123.45 USD. If the format string is '%s%l%c' and the value string to format is '56M' in Euros, the returned formatted string is €56M EUR.

Note: The same format string is used each time the format() method is called on this object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var formatString = '%s%v%c'; var exchangeValue = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyFormatter(formatString);

children.name: GlideCurrencyFormatter(String formatString)
children.text:
Instantiates a GlideCurrencyFormatter object and defines the format string to use to
    format FX Currency.
children.text2: This method does not perform the actual string format. You must call the GlideCurrencyFormatter.format() method to format the currency.

children.name: Output
children.text: Formatted currency: $123,456.12USD

children.name: Example
children.text: var amount = '123456.123456789'; var currencyCode = 'USD'; var formatString = '%s%v%c'; var exchangeValue = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyFormatter(formatString); gs.info('Formatted currency: ' + exchangeValue.setMaxFractionDigits(2).format(amount, currencyCode));

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2:
Currency amount to format. The amount can only contain a decimal point to denote the fractional amount, commas are not supported.

Valid values: 123.45 or 2436.23

Invalid values 123,45 or 2,134.56

children.name: String
children.text: Formatted currency value.

children.name: currencyCode
children.text: String
children.text2: Three-letter ISO currency code to use when formatting the currency.

children.name: format(String value, String currencyCode)
children.text: Formats a specified currency value using the specified currency code.
children.text2: The resulting format of the currency is also dependent on the values passed in when the GlideCurrencyFormatter object was initially instantiated.

children.name: language
children.text: String
children.text2: Two-letter ISO 639 language code, such as en, sp, and fr.

children.name: Output
children.text: Formatted currency: €123 456,12EUR

children.name: Example
children.text: var amount = '123456.123456789'; var currencyCode = 'EUR'; var formatString = '%s%v%c'; var exchangeValue = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyFormatter(formatString); exchangeValue.setLocale("fr", "FR"); // Language = fr Country = FR gs.info('Formatted currency: ' + exchangeValue.setMaxFractionDigits(2).format(amount, currencyCode));
children.text2: This  shows setting the currency formatter to France.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: country
children.text: String
children.text2: Two-letter ISO 3166 country code, such as US, ES, and FR.

children.name: setLocale(String language, String country)
children.text:
Sets the default language and country, which constitutes the locale, for the currency
    formatter.
children.text2: If you do not call this method before calling the GlideCurrencyFormatter.format() method, the locale defaults to the current session locale.

children.name: Output
children.text: Formatted currency: $123,456.12USD

children.name: Example
children.text: var amount = '123456.123456789'; var currencyCode = 'USD'; var formatString = '%s%v%c'; var exchangeValue = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyFormatter(formatString); gs.info('Formatted currency: ' + exchangeValue.setMaxFractionDigits(2).format(amount, currencyCode));

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: maxFractionDigits
children.text: Number
children.text2: Maximum number of fraction digits to return. If this value is set to something less than the minFractionDigits value, it is overridden by minFractionDigits.

children.name: setMaxFractionDigits(Number maxFractionDigits)
children.text:
Sets the maximum number of digits to the right of the decimal point/decimal comma to
    return.

children.name: minFractionDigits
children.text: Number
children.text2: Minimum number of fraction digits to return.

children.name: Output
children.text: Formatted currency: $123,456.120USD

children.name: Example
children.text: var amount = '123456.12'; var currencyCode = 'USD'; var formatString = '%s%v%c'; var exchangeValue = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyFormatter(formatString); gs.info('Formatted currency: ' + exchangeValue.setMinFractionDigits(3).format(amount, currencyCode));

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setMinFractionDigits(Number minFractionDigits)
children.text:
Sets the minimum number of fraction digits (right of the decimal point/decimal comma)
    to return.

name: GlideCurrencyFormatter
text: The GlideCurrencyFormatter API provides methods to format FX Currency strings.
text2:
When instantiating the GlideCurrencyFormatter object, you define the format of the output results for this object. Once set, the same format is used each time you call the GlideCurrencyFormatter.format() method of that object. The GlideCurrencyFormatter() and format() methods are the only two methods that you must call to format FX Currency.

The GlideCurrencyFormatter() API also provides optional methods that enable you to:
  • Set the locale of the currency using setLocale(). By setting the locale, the formatter takes into consideration any formatting that is specific to that locale, such as whether a decimal point or decimal comma is used to denote fractions of currency amount. Default: System locale
  • Set the minimum number of fractional digits to display using setMinFractionDigits(). Defines the minimum number of digits to the right of the decimal point/decimal comma to include. By default, all digits passed in are displayed. If the passed in amount has fewer digits than the specified minimum, the result is padded with "0".
  • Set the maximum number of fractional digits to display using setMaxFractionDigits(). Defines the maximum number of digits to the right of the decimal point/decimal comma to include. By default, all digits passed in are displayed. If the passed in amount has a greater number of digits than the specified maximum, the additional digits are truncated during the process of rounding to the number of maximum fraction digits. Rounding is performed to the closest right-most digit. For example, if the maximum fraction digit is set to 2 and the passed in currency value is 123.456, the formatted value is 123.46. If the currency value is 23.122, the formatted value is 23.12. If the maximum is set to less than the minimum, the minimum value is used.


This class runs is in the sn_currency namespace.

children.name: Example
children.text: var parser = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyParser();

children.name: GlideCurrencyParser()
children.text:
Instantiates a GlideCurrencyParser object that provides methods to parse a string into
    a GlideCurrencyValue object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gp = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyParser(); gp.setLocale("fre", "FRA"); var cv = gp.parse("USD;1234.56"); gs.info(cv);
children.text2: Passes the currency code in value string.

children.name: GlideCurrencyValue
children.text:
Parsed value information.

Data type: Object

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2:
String to parse. You can prepend this string with the ISO currency code to use when parsing the string (semicolon separated). If the currency code is not set prior to calling the parse() method, it defaults to the current session currency code.

This method supports both decimal point and decimal comma notation.

For example: "123.45", "USD;123.45", "123,45", "EUR;123,45"

children.name: Example
children.text: var amount = “1234,56” var gp = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyParser(); gp.setDefaultCurrencyCode("USD"); var cv = gp.parse(amount); gs.info(cv);
children.text2: Uses the setDefaultCurrencyCode property to define currency code.

children.name: parse(String value)
children.text:
Parses a specified string into a GlideCurrencyValue object to obtain locale-based
    currency formatting.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: currencyCode
children.text: String
children.text2:
Three-letter ISO currency code to use as the default in the associated
                GlideCurrencyParser object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var amount = “123.45” var gp = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyParser(); gp.setDefaultCurrencyCode("USD"); var cv = gp.parse(amount);

children.name: setDefaultCurrencyCode(String currencyCode)
children.text: Sets the currency code for the associated GlideCurrencyParser object.

children.name: language
children.text: String
children.text2: Three-letter ISO 639 language code, such as eng, spa, and fre.

children.name: Example
children.text: var amount = “USD;123.45” var gp = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyParser(); gp.setLocale("spa", "ESP"); var cv = gp.parse(amount);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: country
children.text: String
children.text2: Three-letter ISO 3166 country code, such as USA, ESP, and FRA.

children.name: setLocale(String language, String country)
children.text:
Sets the default language and country codes, which constitute the locale, on the
    associated GlideCurrencyParser object.
children.text2: If you do not call this method before calling the GlideCurrencyParser.parse() method, the locale defaults to the current session locale.

name: GlideCurrencyParser
text: The GlideCurrencyParser API provides methods to parse FX Currency values to detect locale-based formatting.
text2:
The methods in this class parse a specified string into a GlideCurrencyValue object enabling you to obtain locale-based currency formatting. Before calling the GlideCurrencyParser.parse() method, which actually performs the parse, you must set the currency code to use during the parse. You can set the currency code by either passing it in the GlideCurrencyParser.parse() method call or by calling GlideCurrencyParser.setDefaultCurrencyCode().

Setting the locale is optional. If you do not set it through the GlideCurrencyParser.setLocale() method, the currency amount passed into GlideCurrencyParser.parse() must be unformatted.

This class runs is in the sn_currency namespace.

children.name: String
children.text: Original currency passed into the parse() method.

children.name: Output
children.text: Original currency amount: 1234.56

children.name: Example
children.text: var gp = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyParser(); gp.setLocale("eng", "USA"); var cv = gp.parse("USD;1234.56"); gs.info('Original currency amount: ' + cv.getAmount());

children.name: getAmount()
children.text: Returns the currency amount originally passed into the associated GlideCurrencyParser.parse() call.

children.name: String
children.text: Three-letter ISO currency code used to parse the currency.

children.name: Output
children.text: Parsed currency code: USD

children.name: Example
children.text: var gp = new sn_currency.GlideCurrencyParser(); gp.setLocale(eng, USA); var cv = gp.parse("USD";"1234.56"); gs.info('Parsed currency code: ' + cv.getCurrencyCode());

children.name: getCurrencyCode()
children.text: Returns the currency code used to parse the currency in the associated GlideCurrencyParser.parse() call.

name: GlideCurrencyValue
text: Provides methods that return the currency code and original currency from an associated GlideCurrencyParser.parse() call.
text2: Note: There is no constructor for this class.
